channel.title: CyberNetSec - Phishing
channel.description: Latest phishing threat intelligence - the last 10 articles

item.title: Massive 'I Paid Twice' Phishing Scheme Defrauds Booking.com Hotels and Guests
item.description:
A sophisticated global phishing campaign named 'I Paid Twice' is targeting hotels on Booking.com and Expedia, compromising their administrative accounts to defraud guests. Since at least April 2025, attackers have been using social engineering and the PureRAT malware to gain access to hotel systems....

Severity: High

Categories: Phishing, Malware, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Finance Execs Targeted in Sophisticated LinkedIn Phishing Scheme with Fake Board Invites
item.description:
A sophisticated phishing campaign is targeting finance executives through LinkedIn direct messages, using fake invitations to an executive board as a lure. The multi-stage attack, detailed by Push Security, aims to harvest Microsoft credentials and session cookies to bypass MFA. The attack chain lev...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Phishing, Threat Actor, Cloud Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: Herodotus Android Malware Mimics Human Typing to Bypass Biometric Security
item.description:
A new Android banking trojan named Herodotus has emerged, offered as a Malware-as-a-Service (MaaS) by a threat actor known as 'K1R0'. The malware is notable for its novel evasion technique: it mimics human typing behavior by introducing random delays during remote control sessions. This method is sp...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Malware, Mobile Security, Phishing

Read Full Article →

item.title: North Korea's BlueNoroff APT Targets macOS Users with New 'GhostCall' Malware
item.description:
The North Korean advanced persistent threat (APT) group BlueNoroff has been linked to two new sophisticated campaigns, 'GhostCall' and 'GhostHire,' which specifically target macOS users. According to Kaspersky, the financially motivated group, a subset of the Lazarus Group, is targeting venture capi...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Malware, Phishing

Read Full Article →

item.title: Microsoft Report: AI-Generated Phishing Now 4.5x More Effective, Bypassing Traditional Defenses
item.description:
According to the Microsoft 2025 Digital Defense Report, the effectiveness of phishing attacks has surged with the adoption of artificial intelligence. AI-generated emails now achieve a 54% click-through rate, 4.5 times higher than traditional methods. The report, covering July 2024 to June 2025, als...

Severity: High

Categories: Phishing, Threat Intelligence, Malware

item.title: Lazarus Group's 'Operation DreamJob' Targets EU Drone-Makers
item.description:
The notorious North Korea-linked APT group, Lazarus, is conducting a cyber-espionage campaign dubbed 'Operation DreamJob' targeting European defense and aerospace companies. The campaign specifically focuses on firms involved in Unmanned Aerial Vehicle (UAV) technology. The attackers use sophisticat...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Cyberattack, Phishing

item.title: Iran's MuddyWater APT Targets 100+ Governments with Phoenix Backdoor
item.description:
The Iranian state-sponsored threat group MuddyWater is conducting a large-scale cyber-espionage campaign targeting over 100 government entities, primarily in the Middle East and North Africa (MENA). According to Group-IB, the attackers are using phishing emails sent from a compromised mailbox, lever...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Cyberattack, Phishing

item.title: Unit 42 Exposes 'Smishing Deluge' from China and 'Jingle Thief' Gift Card Fraud
item.description:
Researchers at Palo Alto Networks' Unit 42 have detailed two distinct and significant cybercrime operations. The first, a massive smishing campaign dubbed 'The Smishing Deluge,' is attributed to a China-based threat actor and is flooding mobile users globally with malicious SMS messages. The second ...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Phishing, Threat Intelligence, Cloud Security

item.title: Critical Netty Zero-Day Bypasses All Major Email Authentication
item.description:
A critical zero-day vulnerability, CVE-2025-59419, has been discovered in the widely used Netty Java library, affecting countless applications that handle email. The flaw allows an unauthenticated attacker to perform SMTP injection by embedding carriage return and line feed characters into email com...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Phishing, Patch Management

item.title: Lending Platform Prosper Breached, 17.6 Million Accounts Exposed
item.description:
The peer-to-peer lending platform Prosper has confirmed a massive data breach that exposed the personal and sensitive information of approximately 17.6 million user accounts. The breach notification service 'Have I Been Pwned' has already incorporated the data set, which includes names, email addres...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Phishing, Regulatory
